item.title: Use the Uchigatana in Your New Elden Ring Build in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/use-the-uchigatana-in-your-new-elden-ring-build-in-2025/

If your Elden Ring build revolves around the Samurai class and move set, chances are you want to track down and equip a second Uchigatana. Even if you’re not playing Samura, knowing where to find the Uchigatana in Elden Ring proves worthwhile, as it is a durable, quick weapon that scales with Strength and Dexterity.

Where is the Uchigatana in Elden Ring?

You can find the Uchigatana one of two ways, either as starting equipment for the Samurai class, as previously mentioned, or out in the world via a dungeon.

For the latter, you’ll find the Uchigatana in Deathtouched Catacombs, in Stormhill, Limgrave, where you’ll have to defeat a few skeletons and activate a lever to unlock the door leading into the hall.

Within the catacombs, fight through the undead until you discover a dead body handing over the edge of the floor. It’s here that you’ll find the Uchigatana.

How Good is the Uchigatana?

The Uchigatana in Elden Ring is one of the best early-game weapons, as it is viable for both Piercing and Slash Damage. Furthermore, its Weapon Skill, Unsheathe, can help you down most bosses with relative ease early on.

Thankfully, you can upgrade the Uchigatana using Smithing Stones, which makes it stronger overall. Over time, the blade will cause bleed buildup, which is ever-useful when dealing with bosses with an increased health pool.

And yes, you can infuse the Uchigatana with Ashes of War. These include the likes of Sword Dance, Vacuum Slice, Bloodhound’s Step, Raptor of the Mists, Lighting Slash, Flame of the Redmanes, Carian Grandeur, Bloody Slash, and Seppuku, among countless others.

Did you find the Uchigatana in Elden Ring? If so, does it play a significant role in your build? Let us know in the comments below, or visit the community forum to find players still enjoying Elden Ring!

item.title: SNK Creates New Studio For Its Fighting Games
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/snk-creates-new-studio-for-its-fighting-games/

SNK has announced the creation of a knew studio for its fighting games called KOF Studio. KOF Studios’ role will be to help “further evolve the SNK fighting game IP”.

The move comes alongside the 30th anniversary of the studio’s The King of Fighters franchise.

“Since their creation in the 1990s, fighting game series such as “Garou Densetsu”, “Samurai Shodown”, and “The King of Fighters” have been loved by fans around the world,” SNK said in its announcement via translation.

Currently, SNK has a number of games in development within the aforementioned franchises. Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is scheduled for release in April 2025, and will be the first release for the series since Fatal Fury: First Contact in 1999. There’s also a new action RPG Samurai Shodown game in early development.

The King of Fighters’ last game launched in 2022. There’s been no mention on when the next game in the series could be coming.

item.title: Stardew Valley Hits Another Sales Milestone
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/stardew-valley-hits-another-sales-milestone/

Stardew Valley has hit another sales milestone. According to the game’s developer ConcernedApe, the game has sold over 41 million copies as of December 2024.

That total puts it roughly 11 million more than the “over 30 million” it surpassed earlier 2024. According to the game’s website, 26 million of the 41 million copies have been sold on PC while another 7.9 million were sold on Nintendo Switch.

Released in 2016, Stardew Valley was a solo-developed game that has continued to see major updates nearly nine years later. The last major update — 1.6 — saw new festivals and events added along with hundreds of other changes.

In addition to game updates, the game continues to hit new player count records. Even the music has found its place in the hearts of players with a full orchestra tour performing the game’s soundtrack. Lastly, a recent study found that Stardew Valley was the best game for reducing stress.
